page.title: 20A WEAVER OF TUNLEY
page.content: In Tunley there lives an expert{weaver of 50 years experience.He lives in a little cottage attached to a converted cart shed which is his workshop. This workshop is full of samples of his work,yarn and houses his three{looms are over 130 years old. he is a member of the{Cotswold Guild of Craftmen}and shows his work in exhibitions.He makes{rugs,soft furnishing and {clothes.}When younger he use to sell his items to important London departments stores.He has 2 pictures of the{Queen}looking at his work. 12years ago he visited Basutoland (Lesotho)in South Africa to teach africans to weave and to help them set up a weaving industry. He loves his weaving,much of it was done with silk he has used his loom for up to 12 hours a day.
